Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka and Pakistan are in a 'dead rubber' match, with both teams likely resting key bowlers.
Babar Azam, despite a poor stretch, is expected to bounce back soon.
Charith Asalanka has been struggling with low scores but will get one more chance.
Sri Lanka might rest Wanindu Hasaranga and bring in Jeffrey Vandersay.
Pakistan may give Naseem Shah a break and consider Hasan Ali or Usman Qadir.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dubai pitch is expected to favor the team batting second, with dew possibly affecting bowlers.
Sixteen of the last 18 matches in Dubai have been won by the chasing side.
Sri Lanka has a 13-8 win record against Pakistan in T20Is, with the last three wins in 2019.
Others: Both teams are dealing with economic struggles, adding context to the match.
Pakistan's Mohammad Rizwan is one of the top performers with 212 runs at a high average.
Sri Lanka's batting has been more consistent recently, especially while chasing.
